definition: to repeat a lesson/to learn by heart/to endorse a check
variant of 背[bei1]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: The third part explores the legal system of indorsement forgery.
sentences.chinese: 本文第三部分探讨了背书伪造法律制度。

sentences.english: The Red Seal endorsement allows for interprovincial mobility.
sentences.chinese: 红印章背书允许跨省流动的。

sentences.english: Endoresment after date has been a difficult point in note theory.
sentences.chinese: 期后背书是票据法中的一个理论难点。

sentences.english: The boy made many blunders as he stumbled through his recitation.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩在讷讷的背书中出了很多差错。

sentences.english: We have the support of the Mayor of Fremantle and the Mayor of Wellington.
sentences.chinese: 我们也有弗里曼特尔市长和威灵顿市长的背书。

sentences.english: NO05,6. Please endorse the back of this check before you deposit it.
sentences.chinese: 存入这张支票前，请在后面背书。

sentences.english: On the Succession of Indorsement of Bill;
sentences.chinese: 目前针对票据背书的研究逐渐增多。

sentences.english: The form of the indorsement James uses will also affect future attempts to negotiate the instrument.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯的背书形式也会影响今后使该票据流通的努力。

sentences.english: It must be an indorsement of the entire bill.
sentences.chinese: 它须为汇票全额之背书。

sentences.english: It was not until the next day, however, that Ma endorsed Wu Poh-hsiung's continuing as KMT chairman.
sentences.chinese: 直到第二天，马才背书吴伯雄继续担任党主席。

sentences.english: That kind of negative endorsement, it’s the opposite of an advertisement.
sentences.chinese: 那样的负面的背书，会起到相反的广告作用。

sentences.english: We have sent the above original B/L to our consignee because of our misplay.
sentences.chinese: 我们在此提交全套的正本提单和银行背书注明货物。

sentences.english: He sent me standing in the courtyard, endorsement, I loudly from a to Z by.
sentences.chinese: 他罚我立在院当中背书，我大声地从头到尾地背书。

sentences.english: He sent me standing in the courtyard, endorsement, I loudly from a to Z by.
sentences.chinese: 他罚我立在院当中背书，我大声地从头到尾地背书。

definition: lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
public trust/credibility
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to review/revision/CL:次[ci4]
to prepare a lesson
shorthand
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet (without ever having burned incense) (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/panic measures in place of timely preparation
(an appendix, note etc) for reference
to give guidance/to mentor/to counsel/to coach/to tutor
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
prestige/distinction/reputation/trust
to write at a tremendous speed
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
